official-title.#text:
To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act
		  of 1968 to authorize veterans’ treatment courts and encourage services for
		  veterans.

) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: in

by adding at the
			 end the following new part:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to award grants for
				developing, implementing, or enhancing veterans’ treatment courts or expanding
				operational mental health or drug courts to serve veterans to ensure that such
				courts effectively integrate substance abuse treatment, mental health
				treatment, sanctions and incentives, and transitional services, in a judicially
				supervised court setting with jurisdiction over offenders who are veterans. The

may award such grants to States, State courts, local courts,
				units of local government, and Indian tribal governments, acting directly or
				through agreements with other public or private entities, for court programs
				that involve—

text.#text: The

coordination with
				appropriate Federal, State, or local prosecutors;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text:
coordination with
				the

the integrated
				administration of other sanctions and services, which shall include—

substance abuse
				and mental health treatment (such as treatment for depression, traumatic brain
				injury, and post-traumatic stress disorder) for each participant who requires
				such treatment;

diversion,
				probation, or other supervised release involving the possibility of
				prosecution, confinement, or incarceration based on non-compliance with program
				requirements or failure to show satisfactory progress; and

offender
				management, which may include aftercare services such as relapse prevention,
				health care, education, vocational training, job placement, housing placement,
				and child care or other family support services for each participant who
				requires such services.

Grant funds made available under this part may not
				be used to provide judicial supervision over, treatment of, or other services
				to violent offenders. A State, State court, local court, unit of local
				government, or Indian tribal government that receives a grant under this part
				may provide such supervision, treatment, or services to violent offenders who
				are otherwise eligible for veterans’ treatment court participation only if such
				supervision, treatment, or services are funded exclusively with non-Federal
				funds.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and any
				other appropriate officials.

text.#text:
In awarding grants under this part, the
				Attorney General shall consult with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, in consultation with the

, issue regulations and guidelines necessary to
				carry out this part.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the

, an application
				for a grant under this part shall—

text.#text:
In
				addition to any other requirements that may be specified by the

include a long-term strategy and
				implementation plan that shall provide for the consultation and coordination
				with appropriate Federal, State and local prosecutors, particularly when
				veterans’ treatment court participants fail to comply with program
				requirements;

explain the applicant’s inability to fund
				the veterans’ treatment court adequately without Federal assistance;

certify that there has been appropriate
				consultation with all affected agencies and that there will be appropriate
				coordination with all affected agencies in the implementation of the veterans’
				treatment court;

specify plans for obtaining necessary
				support and continuing the veterans’ treatment court following the conclusion
				of Federal support; and

describe the methodology that will be used
				in evaluating the veterans’ treatment court.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

a description and an evaluation report on a date
				specified by the

regarding the effectiveness of the veterans’
				treatment court carried out with a grant under this part.

text.#text:
A State, State court, local court, unit of
				local government, or Indian tribal government that receives funds under this
				part during a fiscal year shall submit to the
